lines: ${loverName} has discovered a very sound investment that she thinks could make both of you a lot of money. The investment involves pastry kiosks that will be set up in every major city in the nation. A franchise sells for $40,000 in resources:
twenty thousand to be supplied by you, the other twenty to be invested by ${loverName}. Are you interested?
I'm sorry. You don't have that kind of money to invest.
It is pretty risky to trust a woman you barely know. You invest the money, and
the kiosk does very well. You make back your original $20,000, plus $50,000 more.
the kiosk idea does very poorly. The episode results in a loss of the entire investment.
Don't you have any faith in ${loverName}?
That's true, but she happens to have very good business sense. Are you sure you don't want to give the kiosk idea a try?
${loverName} decides to go with the idea on her own. As a result she becomes a multimillionaire. Too bad!
That's the spirit. You can't make money unless you invest some. Your risk-taking pays off nicely. Your $20,000 parlays itself into a cool MILLION!
